message.content:
<<<api>>>: JsonElement.getAsString
<<<code>>>: Gson gson = new Gson();
RecordingListResponseDTO data = gson.fromJson(json, RecordingListResponseDTO.class);
String status = data.getStatus();
int total = data.getTotal();
int num = data.getNum();
List<FileListDTO> fileList = data.getFileList();
for (FileListDTO file : fileList) {
    int id = file.getId();
    String camname = file.getCamname();
    int camid = file.getCamid();
    Date start = file.getStart();
    Date end = file.getEnd();
    int stream = file.getStream();
    String recReason = file.getRecReason();
    String filename = file.getFilename();
    String snapshot = file.getSnapshot();
    String nvrip = file.getNvrip();
    System.out.println("id: " + id);
    System.out.println("camname: " + camname);
    System.out.println("camid: " + camid);
    System.out.println("start: " + start);
    System.out.println("end: " + end);
    System.out.println("stream: " + stream);
    System.out.println("recReason: " + recReason);
    System.out.println("filename: " + filename);
    System.out.println("snapshot: " + snapshot);
    System.out.println("nvrip: " + nvrip);
}
<<<explanation>>>: The Gson library provides a convenient way to convert JSON strings to Java objects. In this case, you can use the fromJson() method to convert the JSON string to a RecordingListResponseDTO object. Then, you can access the properties of the object using the getter methods. If you are getting null values, make sure that the JSON string is properly formatted and matches the structure of the Java object.

<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
